Getting Around Tbilisi

Complete Transport Guide for Expats

Master Tbilisi's transport system with our comprehensive guide. From metro and buses to taxis and apps, everything you need to navigate the city like a local.

Transport Options

Metro System

Tbilisi's efficient metro system with 2 lines covering major areas

Key Information

  • Operating hours: 6:00 AM - 12:00 AM daily
  • Cost: 1 GEL per ride with transport card
  • Lines: Akhmeteli-Varketili (Line 1) and Saburtalo (Line 2)
  • Key stations: Rustaveli, Freedom Square, Marjanishvili, Station Square

Pro Tip

Buy a transport card for convenience and better rates

Key Metro Stations:

Rustaveli
City center, museums, theaters
Freedom Square
Main square, shopping, restaurants
Avlabari
Old town, churches, cable car
Station Square
Central railway station
Marjanishvili
Theater, shopping centers
Gotsiridze
Residential area, markets

Pros

  • Fast and reliable
  • Air conditioned
  • Covers main areas
  • Safe and clean

Cons

  • Limited coverage
  • Crowded during rush hour
  • No English announcements

City Buses

Extensive bus network covering all neighborhoods

Key Information

  • Operating hours: 7:00 AM - 11:00 PM (most routes)
  • Cost: 1 GEL with transport card, 1.20 GEL cash
  • Popular routes: #37 (Airport), #61 (Mtatsminda), #71 (Vake)
  • Real-time tracking available via mobile apps

Pro Tip

Download the Tbilisi Transport app for real-time schedules

Popular Bus Routes:

#3715-20 min
Airport ↔ Station Square
#6110-15 min
Mtatsminda ↔ Avlabari
#7112-18 min
Vake ↔ Samgori
#8015-20 min
Saburtalo ↔ Old Town
#9520-25 min
Gldani ↔ Varketili

Pros

  • Extensive coverage
  • Frequent service
  • Modern buses
  • Real-time tracking

Cons

  • Can be crowded
  • Traffic delays
  • Limited night service

Taxis & Ride-sharing

Various taxi options from traditional to modern ride-sharing apps

Key Information

  • Bolt, Yandex Go, and local taxi companies available
  • Average cost: 5-15 GEL for city trips
  • Airport rides: 25-35 GEL to city center
  • 24/7 availability with app-based booking

Pro Tip

Use ride-sharing apps for transparent pricing and safety

Available Services:

Bolt
4.5
GPS trackingCard paymentEnglish support
Yandex Go
4.3
Local favoriteCash/card paymentMultiple car types
Maxim
4
Budget optionLocal driversGeorgian interface
Street Taxis
3.5
Negotiate priceCash onlyImmediate availability

Pros

  • Door-to-door service
  • Available 24/7
  • Multiple payment options
  • Safe with apps

Cons

  • More expensive
  • Traffic delays
  • Surge pricing during peak times

Airport Transport

Multiple options to reach Tbilisi International Airport

Key Information

  • Bus #37: 1 GEL, runs every 15-20 minutes
  • Taxi: 25-35 GEL, 30-45 minutes depending on traffic
  • Airport Express: Direct service during peak hours
  • Private transfers: 40-60 GEL, pre-bookable

Pro Tip

Allow extra time during rush hours (8-10 AM, 6-8 PM)

Airport Transport Options:

MethodCostTimeFrequency
Bus #371 GEL45-60 minEvery 15-20 min
Taxi (Bolt/Yandex)25-35 GEL30-45 minOn demand
Airport Taxi30-40 GEL30-45 minAlways available
Private Transfer40-60 GEL30-40 minPre-booked

Pros

  • Multiple price points
  • Reliable connections
  • Direct routes available

Cons

  • Traffic can cause delays
  • Limited late night options
  • Bus can be crowded

Tbilisi Transport Card

Tbilisi Transport Card

Essential for convenient public transport

Benefits:

  • Unified payment for metro and buses
  • Cheaper fares than cash payments
  • No need for exact change
  • Rechargeable at stations and kiosks

Where to Buy:

  • All metro stations
  • Many bus stops
  • Carrefour and Goodwill supermarkets
  • Bank of Georgia branches
  • Online via mobile apps

Costs:

Card fee2 GEL (one-time)
Metro ride1 GEL
Bus ride1 GEL
Cash bus fare1.20 GEL

Transport by Neighborhood

Old Town (Dzveli Tbilisi)

Transport Options

  • • Metro: Avlabari
  • • Buses: 61, 71, 80
  • • Cable car to Narikala

Walkability

High - most attractions within walking distance

Parking

Limited street parking, paid zones

Rustaveli Avenue

Transport Options

  • • Metro: Rustaveli, Freedom Square
  • • Multiple bus routes
  • • Central location

Walkability

Excellent - pedestrian-friendly with wide sidewalks

Parking

Paid parking zones, underground garages available

Vake

Transport Options

  • • Buses: 71, 80, 61
  • • No direct metro connection
  • • Taxi-friendly area

Walkability

Good - tree-lined streets, parks nearby

Parking

Better availability, some free street parking

Saburtalo

Transport Options

  • • Metro: Saburtalo line stations
  • • Multiple bus connections
  • • Modern transport links

Walkability

Moderate - newer development with wider streets

Parking

Good availability, modern parking facilities

Gldani

Transport Options

  • • Metro: Akhmeteli-Varketili line
  • • Bus connections to center
  • • Residential area

Walkability

Low - spread out, car-dependent

Parking

Excellent - plenty of free parking

Expert Tips for Expats

Payment & Cards

  • Get a transport card immediately - saves money and time
  • Keep some cash for taxis that don't accept cards
  • Download payment apps like TBC Pay for easy top-ups
  • Check your card balance regularly at metro stations

Safety & Security

  • Public transport is generally very safe, even at night
  • Keep valuables secure in crowded buses and metro
  • Use official taxi apps rather than street taxis
  • Share your ride details with friends when using taxis

Navigation

  • Download offline maps before traveling
  • Learn key Georgian words for directions
  • Metro stations have English signs, buses may not
  • Ask locals for help - Georgians are very helpful

Peak Hours

  • Avoid metro during rush hours (8-10 AM, 6-8 PM)
  • Allow extra time for airport trips during peak traffic
  • Consider walking short distances during busy periods
  • Night buses run limited routes after 11 PM
